trial_identification.studytitle: Improving Partnerships With Family Members of ICU Patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Improving Partnerships With Family Members of ICU Patients: The IMPACT Trial

interventions.interventions:
Behaviour - Nutrition Education Program Other interventions - Decision Support Program
Experimental: Nutrition Education Program - Nutrition education for family members of an elderly critically ill patient
Experimental: Decision Support Program - Decision support education for family members of an elderly critically ill patient
No Intervention: Usual Care - No intervention
Behaviour: Nutrition Education Program The OPTimal nutrition by Informing and Capacitating family members of best practices (OPTICS) intervention Nutritional education will be provided to ICU patents' families by a dietitian Tracking of nutritional information by family Encouragement for families to advocate for two or more Oral Nutritional Supplements per day for the patients (approximately 400 kcal/day)
Other interventions: Decision Support Program Families will be provided with a web-based decision support tool (My ICU Guide) Families will meet with the ICU medical team early in ICU stay to review goals of care

primaryOutcome.outcome: Nutritional adequacy during the ICU stay

primaryOutcome.timepoint: First four weeks once on ward

primaryOutcome.outcome: Intake on hospital wards (3 day calorie count)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: First four weeks once on ward

primaryOutcome.outcome: Hand grip strength - Hydraulic hand dynamometer
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At or before hospital discharge or up to 90 days

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in decisional conflict - 10-item Decisional Conflict Scale

primaryOutcome.timepoint: At ICU discharge, an average of 12 days

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Inclusion Criteria for Patients:
- have a projected duration of mechanical ventilation of >72 hours from time of screening
- have a family member who meets the following criteria:
Inclusion Criteria for Family Member:
- 18 years of age or older,
- present and expected to visit regularly (minimum about 3 times a week) while the patient is in hospital
- the nominated or legally appointed substitute decision-maker
- able to communicate in English (verbally and in writing).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Patients who are not expected to remain alive in ICU for 72 hours after initial screening (physician judgment) or for whom life-sustaining treatments are expected to be withdrawn in the subsequent 72 hours (as sufficient time will be required for implementation of the study interventions)
- Uncomplicated elective surgical patients (regardless of age)
- Patients receiving long-term tube feeding pre-admission or those who are not anticipated to resume oral intake because of pre-existing swallowing problems (severe dysphagia, stroke, etc.) as they may not benefit from the nutritional intervention
- Patients who have received organ transplantation during this hospitalization

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Clinical Evaluation Research Unit at Kingston General Hospital

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to improve the outcomes of critically ill older patients and the health outcomes of their families by capacitating and partnering with families in optimizing patient/family centered care.
